page.title: 11Guisborough shops II
page.content: Free refuse disposal was wanted by most shop-keepers. At present a charge of 35p.a bag is made.What with the high rates this was felt a disgrace. Better street cleaning & extra police on the beat were also mentioned by some.Most (14) felt a proposed by-pas round the town would hurt their busin- ess,but 3 welcomed it.Asked to comment on the future, most felt it bleak. 'Multiples are taking over; small shops have no chance. In Guisborough the problem comes from Hintons, Fine Fare, Boyes & the Co-op',said one. Guisb.has some specialist shops,e.g. horse riding accessories; music shop. There is a fast expanding book shop, a curtain boutique, delicatessen, shop for bridal access,a gardening & petfood shop, plus the usual range. The catchment area for shopers is wide, extending far into E.Cleveland.
